DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to evaluate and to compare the effectiveness of iv ibuprofen and iv paracetamol during bariatric surgery.
DOC.brief_title: Comparisons of iv Ibuprofen and iv Paracetamol During Bariatric Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: Evaluation of effectiveness of iv ibuprofen and iv paracetamol on postoperative pain, opioid consumption, and side effects in morbidly obese patients undergoing bariatric laparoscopic surgery
DOC.criteria: Patients undergoing laparoscopic sleeve gastrectomy and gastric bypass surgery Hepatic disfunction, Renal failure (creatinine > 3 mg/dL,creatinin clearance < 60 mL/dk or urine output < 500 mL/day ) or a history of dialysis 28 days before surgery, A history of gastrointestinal bleeding or bleeding diathesis 6 weeks before surgery, therapeutic dose of anticoagulation therapy (except subcutaneous heparin prophylactic dose), Angiotensin converting enzymes inhibitor or antihypertensive combination with furosemide, A history of opioid addiction or opioid tolerance Allergy to study drugs, Noncooperative patients for pain assessments
